qas.question: What does the Royal Institute of British Architects award the Stirling Prize for?

answers.text: the best new building of the year

qas.question: What was the first year in which RIBA's Royal Gold Medal was given?
What is the Royal Gold Medal awarded for?
What is the limit of how much can be spent on projects receiving the Stephen Lawrence Prize?
What is the name of the RIBA awards given to students of architecture?

plausible_answers.text: the best new building of the year

qas.question: What does the Royal Institute of British Architects no longer award the Stirling Prize for?
What was the last year in which RIBA's Royal Gold Medal was given?
What is the Royal Gold Medal removed from?
What is the limit of how much can be taken from projects receiving the Stephen Lawrence Prize?
What is the name of the RIBA awards given to professors of architecture?

context: RIBA runs many awards including the Stirling Prize for <a0_0><b5_0>the best new building of the year<b5_0/><a0_0/>, the Royal Gold Medal (first awarded in <a1_0><b6_0>1848<b6_0/><a1_0/>), which honours <a2_0><b7_0>a distinguished body of work<b7_0/><a2_0/>, and the Stephen Lawrence Prize for projects with a construction budget of less than <a3_0><b8_0>£500,000<b8_0/><a3_0/>. The RIBA also awards <a4_0><b9_0>the President's Medals<b9_0/><a4_0/> for student work, which are regarded as the most prestigious awards in architectural education, and the RIBA President's Awards for Research. The RIBA European Award was inaugurated in 2005 for work in the European Union, outside the UK. The RIBA National Award and the RIBA International Award were established in 2007. Since 1966, the RIBA also judges regional awards which are presented locally in the UK regions (East, East Midlands, London, North East, North West, Northern Ireland, Scotland, South/South East, South West/Wessex, Wales, West Midlands and Yorkshire).
